clinical_study.brief_title: Robot-assisted Cognitive Training for Lonely Older Adults With Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI)
clinical_study.official_title: Robot-Assisted Cognitive Training for Socially Isolated Older Adults With Mild Cognitive Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: This study will use a socially assistive robot to deliver cognitive training in the form of a music (piano) learning intervention to socially isolated older adults with mild cognitive impairment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Cognitive training has been shown in past research to improve cognitive function in older adults with and without mild cognitive impairment. Music learning has been previously shown to be a particularly effective form of cognitive training: in addition to the cognitive demands of learning notation, hand positioning, coordination and timing, those who engage in music learning also benefit from emotional connection to the music and social engagement with a music teacher.
Not all older adults are able to access music lessons. Older adults who are homebound, live in rural areas and do not have access to reliable transportation (or a monthly income with sufficient funds for recurring payments for lessons) are unlikely to be able to access these benefits. Socially assistive robots that can deliver both education and companionship on an ongoing basis within the home environment may be a viable solution to these limitations.
The purpose of this study is to deliver cognitive training in the form of a music (piano) learning intervention to older adults who are socially isolated, and who may be able to benefit from the cognitive training aspects of the intervention. A socially assistive robot will deliver the intervention.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Older adults with mild cognitive impairment

primary_outcome.description: Ability to recall words in a list immediately, and after a 30-minute delay
Ability to recall random images immediately, and after a 30-minute delay
Ability to complete tasks that require logical thinking
Ability to execute judgment and decision-making tasks
Ability to adapt to tasks that change in their rule sets
Ability to maintain an attentional state in a challenging visual environment
Ability to complete challenging cognitive tasks quickly

secondary_outcome.description: Socially assistive robot is easy to use
Feelings of fatigue and challenge when using the robot

other_outcome.description: Staging of cognitive impairment based on a structured clinical interview and Global Deterioration Scale

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Be 65 years of age or older Fluent in and able to read in English Able to identify a legally authorized representative to obtain informed consent and be present for the clinical interview Able to sit upright for 30+ minutes Able to view a display approximately 2 feet away Able to hear normal conversation at about 60 Decibels Have no prior piano lesson experience Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status - Modified score of 25-37 during screening Global Deterioration Scale score within early stage / mild cognitive impairment range after clinical interview
Exclusion Criteria:
Younger than age 65 years Unable to speak and read in English Unable to identify a legally authorized representative to obtain informed consent and be present for the clinical interview Unable to sit upright for 30+ minutes Unable to view a display approximately 2 feet away Unable to hear normal conversation at about 60 Decibels Prior piano lesson experience of more than 6 months Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status - Modified score above or below the range of 25-37 during screening Global Deterioration Scale score below or exceeding the range established for mild cognitive impairment.
